trend_summary: 2000-2020 imagery shows a town spreading mainly south-eastward and along the northâ€“south highway. Built-up footprints widen and infill, eating into fields, while surrounding forests stay largely intact. New roads and commercial parcels appear, raising overall urban footprint but leaving large green belts, so the landscape shifts from rural-fringe to clear suburbia.
notable_changes: Progressive residential sprawl in the south-eastern quadrant, replacing cropland.
Infill development within the original town core increases roof density.
New industrial/commercial blocks emerge beside the main highway interchange.
Extension and realignment of secondary roads to serve new estates.
Isolated farmland patches re-forested or converted to recreation greenspace.
